title: Syncthing don't start anymore

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

body:
Hello,
first of all, please apologise for my awfully bad english.

Second, some Infos of my OS, Syncthing and something:
Debian Jessie with 3.14-2-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 3.14.15-2 (2014-08-09) x86_64 GNU/Linux
I use the official Repository with no custom settings in the OS, Kernel or something.
The Version of Syncthing i use is 0.9.5 (go1.3.1 linux-amd64 default). I have downloaded the binary-file from here.
The data i want to sync are encryptet by ecryptfs, because i have a notebook. If i lose it, it's better, that the data encrypted.

Now my problem:
Before i used Syncthing for my data, i have tested it with files, who are not encryptet by ecryptfs. It functioned without problems.
After that, i wanted to sync my encrypted files. Syncthing worked for a time, it indexed (or whatever) the files and at one time it aborted. It was not finished.
When i wanted to start it again, Syncthing didn't. It outputted a long error text.
I tried the whole again, after i deleted the config folder of Syncthing. It worked for a time and aborted again. The same error came, if i started it again.

Befor the error came, it displayed this:
[WJXHB] 15:39:20 INFO: syncthing v0.9.5 (go1.3.1 linux-amd64 default) jenkins@build 2014-08-16 21:05:57 UTC
[WJXHB] 15:39:20 INFO: My ID: ******_-**_***_-**_***_-**_***_-**_***_-**_***_-**_***_-**_****

Then came the error:
panic: xdr read: EOF

goroutine 16 [running]:
runtime.panic(0x8e2a60, 0xc2080ed0a0)
